intro: Psilotrichum ochradenoides, commonly known as the yellow bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, yellow, brush-like inflorescences. The plant has simple, opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairless. Its flowers are bisexual and typically occur in clusters at the ends of the stems. Psilotrichum ochradenoides is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
